result.execSummary:
All charges against Aaron J Peterson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron J Peterson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron J Peterson

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Defendant Aaron J Peterson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CM73, 22CM36
State - asks for warrant to be quashed in 22CM36. Agreement has been reached. Plea to Ct 1 in 22CM73. 1 year DAGP. If successful Ct 1 will be dismissed. Ct 2 and 22CM36 will be dismissed today. 
Court - quashes warrant in 22CM36.
DE - not eligible for PD. Does not want counsel. Understands agreement, charges and penalties.
Court - goes over right to counsel. Finds DE knowingly waives right to counsel. Provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters No Contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM36.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Does not accept plea so that defendant may complete terms of DAGP.
State - asks court to accept joint agreement. Victim rights have been complied with. No restitution requested.

Court orders -
22CM36 - dismissed
22CM73 - Count 2 - dismissed
22CM73 - Count 1 - 1 year DAGP
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 7, 2023 at 08:45 am.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron J Peterson not in court. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - based on non-appearance, moves for warrant
Court - orders warrant

8:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron J Peterson appeared by video without counsel. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - has missed DA Pre-trials
Court - speaks to deft's right to counsel
Deft - waives right to counsel, does not qualify for SPD - asks to schedule a DA Pre-trial
Court - schedules return date
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
